edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib
Class EmulatedNode

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.EmulatedNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class EmulatedNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

   
 Keeps track of information about an emulated node
 The emulated is the Router's abstraction of the client.  It reliably handles messages to and from a single client.

Constructor Detail

EmulatedNode

public EmulatedNode(Router parent,
                    java.net.Socket socket,
                    int addr,
                    java.net.InetAddress ipAddress,
                    int port)
             throws java.io.IOException
Create a new EmulatedNode

Parameters:
parent - A pointer to the router so that it can signal failures
socket - The socket to use to talk to the emulated node
addr - The virtual address of the emulated node
ipAddress - The IP address of the machine that the node is on
port - The port that the emulated node is on
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If creation of the socket fails
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

send

protected boolean send(Packet pkt)
Called by other EmulatedNodes to send a packet to this node. Locking methodology is that this and close() should not call other synchronized blocks (except each other)

Parameters:
pkt - The packet to send
Returns:
true if the send was successful, false otherwise. This is to let the router know when the node is closing and packets should be queued

close

private java.util.LinkedList<Packet> close()
Close the the connection to the node server cleanly. Locking methodology is that this and close() should not call other synchronized blocks (except each other)
